result.execSummary:
The defendant Alissa N. REINKE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Fentanyl), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • PTC Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics (Fentanyl) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To Richard and Sebastiana Novak at 1317 S. 13th Street, Manitowoc, WI; joint and several with Timothy Miller.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or a combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

No contact with Richard and Sebastiana Novak.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Any lectures, speeches and speaking with others about the effects of drugs to be done by the defendant, is at the agent's discretion.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program only after serving 12 months of initial confinement.

State files an Amended Information charging the defendant 1 ct. Deliver Schedule I or II Narcotic (Fentanyl), contrary to Section 961.41(1)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes and 1 ct. PTC Deliver Schedule I or II Narcotic (Fentanyl), contrary to Section 961.41(1)(a) & 939.05 of the Wisconsin Statutes.   No contest pleas to the amended charges.  Convicted.   Court orders a presentence investigation report to be prepared by DOC.   Report to be filed by 10-19-15.  Sentencing hearing is set for 11-02-15 at 9:00 a.m.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn.
Affidavit in Support of Motion to Adjourn Trial.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's statements are admissible at trial.

Order Modifying Daily Report Conditions of Bail Bond.   
The court for the reasons stated on the record grants the defense motion and modifies the bail condition from requiring the defendant to report daily to the Manitowoc Police Department to require that: Defendant shall report each week on Monday and Friday to the City of Manitowoc Police Department.  
In all other respects, the remaining bail conditions are unchanged.  
Copy of Order Modifying Daily Report Conditions of Bail Bond delivered to City PD.

Testimony presented.  Court has reviewed the interview and finds the Miranda-Goodchild guidelines to be appropriate.  Court finds that the statements of March 10, 2014, are and will be admissible at the trial.   
Exhibit 1, copy of Miranda Warning.
Exhibit 2, disk of recorded interview.  
Counsel argue regarding a motion to modifiy defendant's bail.  Court believes that the defendant has evinced a pattern of compliance and will grant the request to modify the reporting requirements.

RE:  Victor Gadzinski, on 02-09-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 1st degree reckless homicide.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-17-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50,000.00 cash with the conditions that she report daily to the Manitowoc City Police Department by 4:00 p.m. that she maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and that she have no contact with Molly Pearson and Timothy Miller.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.

Order Granting Warrant for Records of Communications or Other Information Held by a Provider of Electronic Communications Services and Remote Computing Services. 
For cellphone records for phone number 920-905-9117 from February 1, 2014 through February 10, 2014.
